content:
Parameter Class

Definition

Provides a mechanism that data source controls use to bind to application variables, user identities and choices, and other data. Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET parameter types.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("DefaultValue")]
public class Parameter : ICloneable, System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Inheritance
System.Object
Parameter

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

The Parameter class represents a parameter in a parameterized SQL query, a filtering expression, or a business object method call that an ASP.NET data source control uses to select, filter, or modify data. Parameter objects are contained in a ParameterCollection object. Parameter objects are evaluated at run time, to bind the values of the variables they represent to whatever method is used by a data source control to interact with data.

Use classes that derive from Parameter with data source and data-bound controls to build Web-based data applications. These parameter classes are used by data source controls to bind specific kinds of values found in Web applications to placeholders in SQL query strings, business object method parameters, and more. The following table lists parameter types that are included in ASP.NET.

ControlParameter Binds any public property of a Web server control.
FormParameter Binds a form field.
SessionParameter Binds a session-state field.
RouteParameter Binds a route URL parameter.
CookieParameter Binds a cookie field.
QueryStringParameter Binds a query-string parameter.
ProfileParameter Binds a profile field.

Extend the base Parameter class when you want to implement your own custom parameter types.

Parameter objects are very simple: they have a Name and a Type property, can be represented declaratively, and can track state across multiple HTTP requests. All parameters support a DefaultValue property, for cases when a parameter is bound to a value, but the value evaluates to null at run time.

When using a collection of Parameter objects with a data source control, their order in the collection might matter. For more information on how parameters are used, see Using Parameters with the SqlDataSource Control and Using Parameters with the ObjectDataSource Control.

Constructors

Parameter()

Initializes a new default instance of the Parameter class.

public Parameter ();

Remarks

A Parameter object created with the Parameter constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties. The Name property is initialized to System.String.Empty, the Type property is initialized to System.TypeCode, the Direction property is initialized to ParameterDirection, and the DefaultValue property is initialized to null.

Parameter(String)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class, using the specified name.

public Parameter (string name);
name
String

The name of the parameter.

Remarks

A Parameter object created with the Parameter constructor is initialized with the specified name and default values for its other properties. The Type property is initialized to System.TypeCode, the Direction property is initialized to ParameterDirection, and the DefaultValue property is initialized to null.

Parameter(Parameter)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class with the values of the original, specified instance.

protected Parameter (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter original);
original
Parameter

A Parameter instance from which the current instance is initialized.

Remarks

The Parameter constructor is a protected copy constructor used to clone a Parameter instance. The values of the Name, Type, DefaultValue, Direction, and ConvertEmptyStringToNull properties are all transferred to the new instance.

Parameter(String,DbType)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class, using the specified name and database type.

public Parameter (string name, System.Data.DbType dbType);
name
String

The name of the parameter.

dbType
DbType

The database type of the parameter.

Remarks

A Parameter object created with the Parameter constructor is initialized with the specified name and dbType parameters, and with default values for other properties. The Direction property is initialized to ParameterDirection, and the DefaultValue property is initialized to null.

Parameter(String,TypeCode)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class, using the specified name and type.

public Parameter (string name, TypeCode type);
name
String

The name of the parameter.

type
TypeCode

A TypeCode that describes the type of the parameter.

Remarks

A Parameter object created with the Parameter constructor is initialized with the specified name and type parameters, and default values for other properties. The Direction property is initialized to ParameterDirection, and the DefaultValue property is initialized to null.

Parameter(String,DbType,String)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class, using the specified name, the specified database type, and the specified value for its stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue* property.

public Parameter (string name, System.Data.DbType dbType, string defaultValue);
name
String

The name of the Parameter instance.

dbType
DbType

The database type of the Parameter instance.

defaultValue
String

The default value for the Parameter instance, if the Parameter is bound to a value that is not yet initialized when stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate* is called.

Remarks

The Direction property of the Parameter instance is initialized to ParameterDirection.

Parameter(String,TypeCode,String)

Initializes a new instance of the Parameter class, using the specified name, the specified type, and the specified string for its stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue* property.

public Parameter (string name, TypeCode type, string defaultValue);
name
String

The name of the parameter.

type
TypeCode

A TypeCode that describes the type of the parameter.

defaultValue
String

A string that serves as a default value for the parameter, if the Parameter is bound to a value that is not yet initialized when stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate* is called.

Remarks

A Parameter object created with the Parameter constructor is initialized with the specified name parameter and type parameter, and assigned a DefaultValue property value. The Direction property is initialized to ParameterDirection.

Properties

ConvertEmptyStringToNull

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value that the Parameter object is bound to should be converted to null if it is Empty.

public bool ConvertEmptyStringToNull { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the value that the Parameter is bound to should be converted to null when it is Empty; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

Remarks

If the ConvertEmptyStringToNull property of the parameter is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

DbType

Gets or sets the database type of the parameter.

public System.Data.DbType DbType { get; set; }
Value
DbType

The database type of the Parameter instance. The default value is DbType.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

An attempt was made to set this property to a value that is not in the DbType enumeration.

Remarks

The database type can be used to create strongly typed parameters, so that values are converted correctly between your Web application and underlying code or values from database tables.

If the database type of the parameter is changed by setting the DbType property, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

DefaultValue

Specifies a default value for the parameter, should the value that the parameter is bound to be uninitialized when the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate* method is called.

public string DefaultValue { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that serves as a default value for the Parameter when the value it is bound to cannot be resolved or is uninitialized.

Remarks

The DefaultValue property is used in scenarios where the parameter is bound to a value, but the value is null or cannot be resolved when the Parameter object is evaluated.

If the DefaultValue property of the parameter is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

Direction

Indicates whether the Parameter object is used to bind a value to a control, or the control can be used to change the value.

public System.Data.ParameterDirection Direction { get; set; }
Value
ParameterDirection

One of the ParameterDirection values. Direction is set to ParameterDirection by default.

Remarks

The Direction property is currently not used by the Parameter class and is reserved for future use.

The Direction property describes the direction of the flow of data between the value that a Parameter instance is bound to and the Parameter object itself. The default value for the Direction property, ParameterDirection, describes the most common scenario where the flow of data is always in one direction: from the value to which the Parameter object is bound to the Parameter object. Any changes made to the underlying value are reflected by the Parameter object, but any changes to the Parameter object are not reflected by the underlying data. You can set the Direction property to ParameterDirection or ParameterDirection when working with output parameters, or ParameterDirection when working with a return value from a stored procedure.

If the Direction property of the parameter is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether the Parameter object is saving changes to its view state.

protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, false.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the parameter.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the parameter. The default value is String.

Remarks

Parameter objects are not required to have a name; however, data source controls might use the parameter name to match a Parameter object in a collection with a parameter in a SQL query or business method signature. For example, the SqlDataSource control can use the name of the Parameter object to match a placeholder in a parameterized SQL query. Similarly, the SqlDataSource control can use the name of a Parameter object in the FilterParameters collection to match a placeholder in the FilterExpression property. In some cases, the name is not used and the order in which the Parameter object is added to a ParameterCollection collection is more important. For more information, see Using Parameters with the SqlDataSource Control and Using Parameters with the ObjectDataSource Control.

If the name of the parameter is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

Size

Gets or sets the size of the parameter.

public int Size { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The size of the parameter expressed as an integer.

Remarks

When the value for Size is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

Type

Gets or sets the type of the parameter.

public TypeCode Type { get; set; }
Value
TypeCode

The type of the Parameter. The default value is TypeCode.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The parameter type is not one of the TypeCode values.

Remarks

The type can be used to create strongly typed parameters, so that values are converted correctly between your Web application and underlying code.

If the type of the parameter is changed, the OnParameterChanged method is called.

ViewState

Gets a dictionary of state information that allows you to save and restore the view state of a Parameter object across multiple requests for the same page.

protected System.Web.UI.StateBag ViewState { get; }
Value
StateBag

An instance of StateBag that contains the Parameter object's view-state information.

Remarks

A parameter's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. To preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. View state is enabled for all server controls by default.

For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see Collections and Data Structures.

Methods

Clone()

Returns a duplicate of the current Parameter instance.

protected virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter Clone ();
Returns
Parameter

A Parameter that is an exact duplicate of the current one.

Remarks

The Clone method calls the Parameter(Parameter) copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the Parameter class with the values of the current instance.

If you extend the Parameter class, you can override the Clone method to include any state that should be copied to a new instance of your derived class.

ConvertDbTypeToTypeCode(DbType)

Converts a DbType value to an equivalent TypeCode value.

public static TypeCode ConvertDbTypeToTypeCode (System.Data.DbType dbType);
dbType
DbType

A DbType value to convert to an equivalent TypeCode value.

Returns
TypeCode

A TypeCode value that is equivalent to the specified DbType value.

Remarks

This method returns an TypeCode instance if no equivalent for the DbType value is found. Database types without equivalent types include DbType, DbType, and DbType.

ConvertTypeCodeToDbType(TypeCode)

Converts a TypeCode value to an equivalent DbType value.

public static System.Data.DbType ConvertTypeCodeToDbType (TypeCode typeCode);
typeCode
TypeCode

The TypeCode value to convert to an equivalent DbType value.

Returns
DbType

A DbType value that is equivalent to the specified TypeCode value.

Remarks

This method returns an DbType instance if no equivalent is found. Types without equivalent database types include TypeCode and TypeCode.

Evaluate(HttpContext,Control)

Updates and returns the value of the Parameter object.

protected virtual object Evaluate (System.Web.HttpContext context, System.Web.UI.Control control);
context
HttpContext

The current HttpContext of the request.

control
Control

The Control the parameter is bound to. If the parameter is not bound to a control, the control parameter is ignored.

Returns
System.Object

An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter.

Remarks

The default implementation of the Evaluate method is to return null in all cases. Classes that derive from the Parameter class override the Evaluate method to return an updated parameter value. For example, the ControlParameter object returns the value of the control that it is bound to, while the QueryStringParameter object retrieves the current name/value pair from the HttpRequest object.

GetDatabaseType()

Gets the DbType value that is equivalent to the CLR type of the current Parameter instance.

public System.Data.DbType GetDatabaseType ();
Returns
DbType

The DbType value that is equivalent to the CLR type of the current Parameter instance.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DbType* property is already set to a value other than DbType.

Remarks

The DbType property must not already have been set, or must be set to DbType. This method is intended for use only when the CLR type is set but the DbType property is not.

LoadViewState(Object)

Restores the data source view's previously saved view state.

protected virtual void LoadViewState (object savedState);
savedState
System.Object

An Object that represents the Parameter state to restore.

Remarks

This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see ASP.NET State Management Overview.

This method restores view-state information for the Parameter object from a previous page request that was saved by the SaveViewState method.

OnParameterChanged()

Calls the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnParametersChanged* method of the ParameterCollection collection that contains the Parameter object.

protected void OnParameterChanged ();

Remarks

If the Parameter object is not contained by a ParameterCollection collection, calling the OnParameterChanged method has no effect. If the Parameter object is contained by a ParameterCollection collection, OnParameterChanged raises the System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged event of the collection.

If the ParameterCollection collection is contained by a data source control, the System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged event raises the data source control's DataSourceChanged event, causing any data-bound controls to rebind.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

The OnParameterChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to the Parameter object's view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.

protected virtual object SaveViewState ();
Returns
System.Object

The Object that contains the changes to the Parameter view state. If there is no view state associated with the object, this method returns null.

Remarks

This method is used primarily by control developers.

View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties. These values are automatically placed in the server control's ViewState property, which is an instance of the StateBag class. This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.

When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML hidden element. When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's ViewState property.

SetDirty()

Marks the Parameter object so its state will be recorded in view state.

protected virtual void SetDirty ();

Remarks

The SetDirty method is called directly by the SetDirtyObject method, to mark the Parameter object so that its state is recorded in view state.

ToString()

Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string representation of the value of this instance.

Remarks

The ToString method returns the Name property of the Parameter object. If the Parameter object has no name, ToString returns System.String.Empty.

TrackViewState()

Causes the Parameter object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* object and persisted across requests for the same page.

protected virtual void TrackViewState ();

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICloneable.Clone()

Returns a duplicate of the current Parameter instance.

object ICloneable.Clone ();
Returns
System.Object

A Parameter that is a copy of the current object.

Remarks

The Clone method calls the Parameter(Parameter) constructor to initialize a new instance of the Parameter class with the values of the current instance.

If you extend the Parameter class, you can override the Clone method to include any state that should be copied to a new instance of your derived class.

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether the Parameter object is saving changes to its view state.

bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, false.

IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

Restores the data source view's previously saved view state.

void IStateManager.LoadViewState (object savedState);
savedState
System.Object

An Object that represents the Parameter state to restore.

Remarks

This method restores view-state information for the Parameter object from a previous page request that was saved by the SaveViewState method.

This method is used primarily by control developers. You can override this method to control how a custom server control restores its view state.

IStateManager.SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to the Parameter object's view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.

object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();
Returns
System.Object

The Object that contains the changes to the Parameter object's view state. If there is no view state associated with the object, this method returns null.

Remarks

This method is used primarily by control developers.

View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties. These values are automatically placed in the server control's ViewState property, which is an instance of the StateBag class. This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.

When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML hidden element. When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's ViewState property.

IStateManager.TrackViewState()

Causes the Parameter object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* object and persisted across requests for the same page.

void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();
